title: Brief Explanation of the chant "GWONG FUK HEUNG GONG"

replies.msg:
Word for word translation and rough pronunciations:

光 Gwong - "Light"
復 Fuk - "Returns"
香 Heung - "Hong"
港 Gong - "Kong"

時 Si - "Time"
代 Doi - "Generation"
革 Gak - "Change"
命 Ming - "Fate"

Si Doi = "Times"
Gak Ming = "Revolution"

How to chant:

One person leads: "GWONG FUK HEUNG GONG!! "

Others follows: "SI DOI GAK MING!! "

Background:
One of our chant "Liberate Hong Kong, Revolution of our Times", came from the election campaign of Edward Leung.

Edward Leung
Edward Leung Tin-kei (Chinese: 梁天琦; born 2 June 1991) is a Hong Kong student and activist. He is the former spokesman of Hong Kong Indigenous, a localist group.





Edward Leung is now behind bars, but his will and vision continue to spread all over HK and the world.
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Leung

there are no official explanation of this chant, both

"Liberate Hong Kong
Revolution of our Times"

"Free Hong Kong
Revolution Now"

are used for the English version.

replies.msg:
in fact I think #FREEHK is good enough tho
but it's up to the majority

i guess jyutping is a bit more popular for those who are learning cantonese pronunciation, so here you go:

gwong1 fuk6 hoeng1 gong2
光復香港
si4 doi6 gaak3 ming6
時代革命


also heres another one that i love way before the current movement.

tin1 mit6 zung1 gung6
天滅中共
may the sky destroy the ccp.
(sky by this could mean heaven/god, not in a religious way tho, maybe more like karma)
